title: Massacre of The Unicorns
author: Not specified in the provided text.
date_published: Not specified in the provided text.
dek: This article critiques the inherent flaws in psychiatric diagnosis and treatment, arguing that the system's failings stem from its flawed structure and semiotic inconsistencies.  Using examples like the misdiagnosis of bipolar disorder and the arbitrary definition of terms like "antidepressant-induced mania," the author challenges the validity of psychiatric classifications based on subjective interpretations rather than objective pathology.
